meanings.definition: The quality or state of being pastoral.
meanings.sent1: The pastoralness of the countryside brought a sense of peace and tranquility.
meanings.sent2: The pastoralness of the farm was evident in the rolling green fields and grazing animals.
meanings.sent3: The pastoralness of the picnic was interrupted by a curious group of ducks.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings captured the pastoralness of rural life with vivid colors and serene landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The pastoralness of the meadow at dawn was like a painting come to life.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or qualities associated with a pastoral setting or lifestyle.
meanings.sent1: The pastoralness of the village was reflected in its close-knit community and simple way of life.
meanings.sent2: She longed for the pastoralness of the countryside after years of city living.
meanings.sent3: The pastoralness of the shepherd's outfit made him stand out in the bustling city.
meanings.sent4: The pastoralness of her voice was soothing, like a gentle breeze on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The pastoralness of the old barn carried memories of a bygone era.
